Packagecom.nitrolm
Classpublic class LicenseClient
InheritanceLicenseClient flash.events.EventDispatcher

LicenseClient is the main class used for communicating to Nitro-LM Servers

LicenseClient()Constructor
public function LicenseClient(debug:Boolean = false)

Create a new LicenseClient instance

Parameters
debug:Boolean (default = false) — If enabled, the native library will write a file called nitrolm_debug.out
Method Detail
applyManualLicense()method
public function applyManualLicense(outputData:String):int

A manual license type is useful when a user is operating offline most of the time. A user can request a manual license, and paste the response string into a form at nitrolm.com->Install/Support->Manual License Request. The response from the tool at the Manual License Website can then be applied using this method.

Parameters

outputData:String — The string returned as output from the Manual License Request website.

Returns
int

See also

getManualLicense()
canSendRequest()method 
public function canSendRequest(productCode:String):int

This method checks to see if ProductKeys contains a valid key for this product in order to communicate with the NitroLM server.

Parameters

productCode:String — The product code to check

Returns
int — value like (RESPONSE_OK, RESPONSE_NO_KEY, RESPONSE_NO_MACIDS)

See also

NLMConstants.RESPONSE_OK
NLMConstants.RESPONSE_NO_KEY
NLMConstants.RESPONSE_NO_MACIDS
changePassword()method 
public function changePassword(email:String, oldpwd:String, newpwd:String, newpwd2:String):void

This method changes a user's password and dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE. Make sure you add an event listener for this type before calling the method. Remove your event listener in the handling method. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation.

Note: This method encrypts all data before communicating the password change to the NitroLM license server.

Parameters

email:String — String value of the user's e-mail address
 
oldpwd:String — String value of the user's old password
 
newpwd:String — String value of the password to change to
 
newpwd2:String — String value needs to be identical to newpwd

See also

LicenseClientEvent
checkUsageCounter()method 
public function checkUsageCounter(productCode:String):int

This method checks to see whether this user has exceeded warning or maximum levels for number of product execution runs.

Parameters

productCode:String — The product code

Returns
int — value like (RESPONSE_OK, RESPONSE_EXCEEDED_WARN_EXEC, RESPONSE_EXCEEDED_MAX_EXEC, RESPONSE_INTERNAL_CLIENT_ERROR)

See also

getLicenseInfo()
NLMConstants.RESPONSE_OK
NLMConstants.RESPONSE_EXCEEDED_WARN_EXEC
NLMConstants.RESPONSE_EXCEEDED_MAX_EXEC
NLMConstants.RESPONSE_INTERNAL_CLIENT_ERROR
checkUser()method 
public function checkUser(email:String, checkConfirmed:Boolean):void

This method checks a user account for validity in accessing this product. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_CHKUSER. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation. event.data contains a Map containing keys and values.

Parameters

email:String — the user's e-mail address
 
checkConfirmed:Boolean — Make sure the user has confirmed their registration

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_CHKUSER
com.nitrolm.data.Map
createUser()method 
public function createUser(email:String, password:String, firstName:String, lastName:String, phone:String, address1:String, address2:String, city:String, state:String, zip:String, country:String, user_company:String, market_source:String, corpId:String, version:String, regSource:String, mailType:int, extraData:Map):void

This method creates a new user registration request in NitroLM. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_NEWUSER. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation.

Parameters

email:String — the user's e-mail address. a confirmation e-mail will be sent to this address
 
password:String — the user's initial password
 
firstName:String — the user's first name
 
lastName:String — the user's last name
 
phone:String — the user's telephone number
 
address1:String — line 1 of the user's address
 
address2:String — (optional) set to null if not needed
 
city:String — the user's city
 
state:String — the user's state or province
 
zip:String — the user's zipcode
 
country:String — the user's country of origin
 
user_company:String — the user's company they work for as a standard string name.
 
market_source:String — where the user got/downloaded the product from. could be a reseller's name. if used for reseller, should be equal to "RES-"+reseller_name. By default, you should set this to "LIC-"+your_licensee_name
 
corpId:String — the corporate id for the company that will issue licenses for this user. The user doesn't "have" to always use this corpId in the future, but it does have to be a valid corpId for user creation to be successful. (null or "" to skip this check)
 
version:String — the version of app that requested this user be created (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)
 
regSource:String — text string describing which location or application the user is registering through. Added to registration e-mails sent through notifications.
 
mailType:int — Tells the server which type of confirmation e-mail to send. NLMConstants.CONFIRM_MAIL_BOTH, NLMConstants.CONFIRM_MAIL_LINKONLY, NLMConstants.CONFIRM_MAIL_CODEONLY, or NLMConstants.CONFIRM_MAIL_AUTO. Most use cases should be LINKONLY
 
extraData:Map — any custom user information you want to save. Stored in the Map as name/value pairs.

See also

NLMConstants.CONFIRM_MAIL_BOTH
NLMConstants.CONFIRM_MAIL_LINKONLY
NLMConstants.CONFIRM_MAIL_CODEONLY
NLMConstants.CONFIRM_MAIL_AUTO
data.Map

Used internally by EncryptedModuleLoader and EncryptedModuleManager to decrypt and load encrypted SWF modules completely in native code

decryptAndLoadRSL()method 
public function decryptAndLoadRSL(e_bytes:ByteArray, applicationDomain:ApplicationDomain, loadRSLComplete:Function):int

Decrypts and loads RSL swf code completely from native code. Pass in the encrypted RSL bytes to have the system load its code into the AIR runtime.

Parameters

e_bytes:ByteArray — encrypted bytes from your RSL swf.
 
applicationDomain:ApplicationDomain — the application domain to load the code into
 
loadRSLComplete:Function — - callback function handler for when code decryption and loading is done.

Returns
int — RESPONSE_OK if everything succeeded
disableLicense()method 
public function disableLicense(productCode:String):int

This method disables the license already retrieved for the currently active user. This method makes no server calls and only disables the license locally. Most of the time, you should use releaseLicense(). It's called internally to clean up expired licenses.

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code

Returns
int

See also

releaseLicense()
dispose()method 
public function dispose():void

Call this method before closing your AIR application to dispose of the native ExtensionContext

See also

ExtensionContext.dispose()
emailSupport()method 
public function emailSupport(productCode:String, version:String, sender:String, type:String, message:String):void

This method is used to trigger an e-mail to the support team for this product. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_SUPPORT. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation.

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code
 
version:String — the product version needing support (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)
 
sender:String — the email address the person sending the support request. (must be a registered user)
 
type:String — the type of support request (NLMConstanants.SUPPORT_SALES, NLMConstants.SUPPORT_TECH, or NLMConstants.SUPPORT_ENHANCE)
 
message:String — the message to send to support

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_SUPPORT
NLMConstants.SUPPORT_SALES
NLMConstants.SUPPORT_TECH
NLMConstants.SUPPORT_ENHANCE
extendProduct()method 
public function extendProduct(email:String, corpId:String, productCode:String, version:String, days:int):void

This method is used to request that a valid-until date for a product in a pool be pushed out X days. An e-mail will be sent to people on the notification list for PE - Product Extension Requests who will have the ability to approve/deny the request. If approved, the valid-until date for the product in the requesting user's pool will be extended for X days. The requesting user will be e-mailed letting them know the decision of the approver for Product Extensions. This method dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_EXTEND_PRODUCT Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation.

Parameters

email:String — the user's e-mail who is requesting a product extension
 
corpId:String — the corporate id so the server knows which pool(s) to look for the product to extend
 
productCode:String — the product code that will have its valid-until date extended in the pool.
 
version:String — the product version. leave blank or null to skip version checking
 
days:int — the number of days to extend the valid-until date for.

See also

LicenseClientEvent
getAppLogin()method 
public function getAppLogin(email:String, password:String, corpId:String, productCode:String, version:String):void

This method validates the user/password/company/product/version combination and generates an appid token string to use later with getLicenseAppid() It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_GETAPPLOGIN. LicenseClientEvent.data contains the appid string used in getLicenseAppid(). Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation. event.data contains a HashMap containing keys and values.

Parameters

email:String — the user's e-mail address
 
password:String — the user's password
 
corpId:String — the company's corporate id to get the app login from
 
productCode:String — the product code
 
version:String — the product version (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)

See also

getLicenseAppid()
LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_GETAPPLOGIN
getCustomerProducts()method 
public function getCustomerProducts(corpId:String, email:String):void

This method retrieves products owned by a given company that a user has access to. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_GETPRODUCTS. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation. event.data contains an Array of Objects like {name: product_name, description: product_description}.

Parameters

corpId:String — the company's corporate id whose products you want to retrieve
 
email:String — the user whose products you want to retrieve

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_GETPRODUCTS
getCustomValue()method 
public function getCustomValue(productCode:String, version:String, varname:String):String

This method retrieves a custom license value. Custom Values are the variable values that are set up in NitroAdmin for pools or products.

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code
 
version:String — the version which wrote this custom value (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)
 
varname:String — the variable name to retrieve

Returns
String — String - The variable value or null
getCustomValues()method 
public function getCustomValues(productCode:String, version:String, values:Map):int

This method retrieves all custom license values. Custom Values are the variable values that are set up in NitroAdmin for pools or products.

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code
 
version:String — product version (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)
 
values:Map — the Map that will hold the custom license values (must not be null)

Returns
int — value like (RESPONSE_OK, RESPONSE_INVALID_LICENSE)

See also

NLMConstants.RESPONSE_OK
NLMConstants.RESPONSE_INVALID_LICENSE
getExternalValues()method 
public function getExternalValues(productCode:String):Array

This method retrieves the customer list and values (AID, etc.) that are in the license's pool and its children. The custom values are variables/values defined on the server by the administrator, and are downloaded to the user's PC when they get or renew a license. Because the values are downloaded, they are available even when the user is working offline.

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code

Returns
Array — Array of Map objects each containing 3 entries
getLicense()method 
public function getLicense(email:String, password:String, corpId:String, productCode:String, version:String, type:String, days:int, market_source:String, useQueue:Boolean = false):void

This method retrieves a license from the NitroLM server. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_GETLICENSE. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation.

Parameters

email:String — the user's e-mail address
 
password:String — the user's password
 
corpId:String — the company's corporate id code requesting a license. if null, then retrieve a Demo license (days param is ignored).
 
productCode:String — the product code
 
version:String — the version of this product to retrieve a license for. (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)
 
type:String — the type of license to retrieve. LOCK_FIXED, LOCK_FLOATING, or LOCK_DEMO. If the type is none of these, the Default license type for this product is used.
 
days:int — this value must be > 0 to retrieve a demo or fixed license. It is ignored for floating license types.
 
market_source:String — If used, should be equal to "LIC-"+reseller_name
 
useQueue:Boolean (default = false) — true if you want to allow users to queue license requests if none are available.

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_GETLICENSE
NLMConstants.LOCK_FIXED
NLMConstants.LOCK_FLOATING
NLMConstants.LOCK_DEMO
getLicenseAppid()method 
public function getLicenseAppid(appid:String, productCode:String, version:String, market_source:String, useQueue:Boolean = false):void

This method is useful for servers with downloadable software. The server can store an app-id locally so that when the user fires up the downloaded app, they don't have to re-login. This has only really be used on the Java client for NitroLM, so if you have a need to use it here, talk NitroLM support first. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_GETLICENSE_APPID. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation.

Parameters

appid:String — the application identifier
 
productCode:String — the product to get a license for
 
version:String — the product version (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)
 
market_source:String — If used, should be equal to "LIC-"+licensee_name or "RES-"+reseller_name
 
useQueue:Boolean (default = false) — true if you want to allow users to queue license requests if none are available.

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_GETLICENSE_APPID
getLicenseDefault()method 
public function getLicenseDefault(email:String, password:String, corpId:String, productCode:String, version:String, market_source:String, useQueue:Boolean = false):void

This method retrieves the default license type for this product and default number of checkout days(if retrieving a checked out license). Default values are configured in the NitroLM Admin tool under My Products. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_GETLICENSE_DEFAULT. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation.

Parameters

email:String — the user's e-mail address
 
password:String — the user's password
 
corpId:String — the company's corporate id code for requesting a license. if null, then retrieve a Demo license
 
productCode:String — the product code
 
version:String — the product version (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)
 
market_source:String — if used, should be equal to "LIC-"+licensee_name or "RES-"+reseller_name
 
useQueue:Boolean (default = false) — true if you want to allow users to queue license requests if none are available.

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_GETLICENSE_DEFAULT
getLicensedProducts()method 
public function getLicensedProducts():Array

This method retrieves a list of products that currently have licenses on this machine. Note that they might be old or expired licenses

Returns
Array — Array of Objects each having String properties "product" and "description"
getLicenseInfo()method 
public function getLicenseInfo(productCode:String, licenseValues:Map):int

This method retrieves license info values from the currently active license such as when the license will expire. This method doesn't communicate with the NitroLM server.

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code
 
licenseValues:Map — contains the values retrieved from the license. (must not be null)

Returns
int — value like (RESPONSE_OK, RESPONSE_INVALID_PRODUCT)
getManualLicense()method 
public function getManualLicense(productCode:String, version:String, market_source:String):String

This method generates a key for this machine to use on the Manual License Request website. A manual license type is useful when a user is operating offline most of the time. A user can request a manual license, and later paste the response string into a form at https://license.nitromation.com/NitroLicenseServer/SWF/NitroOL.html when online. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_GETMANUAL.

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code
 
version:String — the product version (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)
 
market_source:String — if used, should be equal to "LIC-"+licensee_name or "RES-"+reseller_name

Returns
String — String - the manual license request string to paste into the manual request website when online.

See also

applyManualLicense()
LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_GETMANUAL
getMessages()method 
public function getMessages(email:String, version:String, days:int):void

This method retrieves server messages for a given user. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_MESSAGES. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation. event.data contains an Array of Objects having String properties subject and body. First character of body == space if the message has already been read, (asterisk) if it's a new unread message

Parameters

email:String — the email address to retrieve messages for
 
version:String — the product version (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)
 
days:int — the number of days back to look for messages

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_MESSAGES
getProxy()method 
public function getProxy():Map

Get the current HTTP proxy settings. Since all communication to the server happens inside native code, we can't rely on AIR's automatic proxy support.

Returns
Map — Map containing the keys host, port, user, password, and nonProxyHosts
getSessionData()method 
public function getSessionData(version:String, appid:String):void

This method retrieves session data. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_SESSIONDATA. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation. event.data contains a Map containing keys and values. event.response will be equal to NLMConstants.RESPONSE_SESS_TIMEOUT if the session has timed out.

Parameters

version:String — the version (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)
 
appid:String — the application identifier

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_SESSIONDATA
NLMConstants.RESPONSE_SESS_TIMEOUT
getUserVar()method 
public function getUserVar(productCode:String, varname:String):void

This method retrieves a user variable from the server. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_GETUSERVAR. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation. event.data contains a Map containing keys and values.

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code
 
varname:String — the user variable name to retrieve

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_GETUSERVAR
hasLicenses()method 
public function hasLicenses():Boolean

This method checks to see if this machine has any licenses on it for any product. Use validate to see if a license is actually valid and not expired or disabled.

Returns
Boolean — true if licenses exist, false otherwise

See also

validate()
incUsageCounter()method 
public function incUsageCounter(productCode:String):void

This method increments the usage counter for the given product

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code

logVariables()method 
public function logVariables(productCode:String, report:String, varnames:Array):void

This method writes a log entry on the NitroLM server. The first time you use a particular report name, the varnames parameter will specify what variables belong on the report. After that, you must either pass the same list of varnames each time you use that particular report name, or you must pass null for the varnames parameter. If you pass a different list of varnames to an existing report, you will get a NLMConstants.RESPONSE_VARS_MISMATCH error. This function does not set any variable names, rather just stores the current values.

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code
 
report:String — the report name you want to log variables to
 
varnames:Array — variable names that you want to store current values of along with this log entry

putPublicKey()method 
public function putPublicKey(productCode:String, key:ByteArray):int

This method stores a product key for use in communicating with the NitroLM servers

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code
 
key:ByteArray — the key to use in communicating with this productCode

Returns
int
readUsageCounter()method 
public function readUsageCounter(productCode:String):int

This method retrieves the usage counter

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code

Returns
int — the current usage counter value
refreshLicense()method 
public function refreshLicense(productCode:String, version:String):void

This method will refresh the user's current license. A refresh is like a renew, except that it does not extend the valid period of the license. It can be used to acquire the most current license information from the server, such as updated license variables, libraries, or administrator-updated expiration dates. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_REFRESHLICENSE.

Parameters

productCode:String — The product code for the license.
 
version:String — The version of the product for the license. Used for version checking; pass a blank string or null to omit the version check.

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_REFRESHLICENSE
releaseLicense()method 
public function releaseLicense(productCode:String, version:String, serveronly:Boolean = false):void

This method releases a license so that others can use it It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_RELEASELICENSE. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation.

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code
 
version:String — the product version (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)
 
serveronly:Boolean (default = false) — this parameter can only be set to true for Floating licenses. Setting serveronly to true for a floating license will cause the license to be automatically re-acquired the next time you try to use the license. Until then other users will be able to use the license.

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_RELEASELICENSE
NLMConstants.RESPONSE_RELEASED
renewLicense()method 
public function renewLicense(productCode:String, version:String, days:int):void

This method renews a LOCK_FIXED (checkout) license for an additional number of days. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_RENEWLICENSE. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation.

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code
 
version:String — the product version (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)
 
days:int — the value should be 0 for a floating license. The days value is ignored for demo licenses. If you specify days>0 on a floating license then the license will be converted to a checked-out license.

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_RENEWLICENSE
requestKey()method 
public function requestKey(productCode:String, version:String):void

This method requests a product decryption key to be downloaded from the NitroLM server. If you're using EncryptedModuleLoader, EncryptedModuleManager, decryptAndLoad(), or decryptAndLoadRSL(), you don't need to call this method as it's called internally. You must have a valid license for the product specified in order to call this method. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_KEY. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation. event.data contains a HashMap with the key "key".

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code
 
version:String — the product version (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_KEY
decryptAndLoad()
decryptAndLoadRSL()
resetPassword()method 
public function resetPassword(email:String, market_source:String):void

This method will allow the user to reset their password. It will cause an email to be sent to the user that contains a link to the reset-password web page.

The source field has a dual purpose. It can either

  1. contain freeform text indicating where the user heard of the software, or
  2. contain a special code to indicate that the user will be associated with a licensee or reseller even before they get a license for any product. The code will be LIC-<company code> for a licensee, or RES-<company code> for a reseller. (For example, LIC-acme27)
Besides associating the user with a particular licensee or reseller, using the special code will also let the server locate the custom email templates, if any, that were defined for that licensee/reseller.

Parameters

email:String — The user's email address.
 
market_source:String — The user's or application's market_source. The application can set its own special market_source value which will override the user's value for this one function.

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_RESET_PASSWORD
sendConfirm()method 
public function sendConfirm(email:String, code:String):void

This method sends a confirmation code that the user received in an e-mail to the NitroLM server in order to confirm them as a valid user. This method is only used if NLMConstants.CONFIRM_MAIL_BOTH or CONFIRM_MAIL_CODEONLY was sent to createUser(). It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_CONFIRM. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation.

Parameters

email:String — the user's e-mail address
 
code:String — the value received in the user's confirmation e-mail.

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_CONFIRM
NLMConstants.CONFIRM_MAIL_CODEONLY
sendSurvey()method 
public function sendSurvey(reseller:String, data:Map):void

This method sends a reseller survey. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_SURVEY. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation.

Parameters

reseller:String — the reseller's name
 
data:Map — key/value pairs of data that are of interest to the reseller

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_SURVEY
setProxy()method 
public function setProxy(host:String, port:int = 80, user:String = null, pass:String = null, nonProxyHosts:String = null):int

Set HTTP proxy settings for communicating to NitroLM. This only needs to be done one time. NitroLM saves the proxy information to its local database file.

Parameters

host:String — the hostname of the http proxy server (e.g. proxy.company.com)
 
port:int (default = 80) — the port of the http proxy server (e.g. 8080)
 
user:String (default = null) — the username for the proxy server. null if the server doesn't require authentication
 
pass:String (default = null) — the password for the proxy server. null if the server doesn't require authentication.
 
nonProxyHosts:String (default = null) — comma-separated list of addresses to bypass the proxy server

Returns
int
setUserFile()method

This method saves a user file on the license server. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_SETUSERFILE. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation.

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code
 
filename:String — the file's name

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_SETUSERFILE
setUserVar()method 
public function setUserVar(productCode:String, varname:String, value:String):void

This method sets a user-specific variable on the license server. It dispatches a LicenseClientEvent of type LicenseClientEvent.LICENSE_RESPONSE with a req_type of NLMConstants.REQUEST_SETUSERVAR. Use NLMConstants.responseToString(event.response) in your event handler to determine the result of this operation.

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code
 
varname:String — varname is restricted to names that the admin has predefined in NitroAdmin for the licensee variables.
 
value:String — the value to set

See also

LicenseClientEvent
NLMConstants.REQUEST_SETUSERVAR
validate()method 
public function validate(productCode:String, version:String):int

This method checks to see if this machine already has a valid license to run this product/version combination. It also causes a floating license to be auto-renewed.

Parameters

productCode:String — the product code
 
version:String — the product version (null, "", or "0" will skip version checking)

Returns
int — value like (RESPONSE_OK, RESPONSE_INVALID_PRODUCT, RESPONSE_INVALID_LICENSE, RESPONSE_DISABLED_RENEW, RESPONSE_EXCEEDED_MAX_EXEC, RESPONSE_DISABLED_RENEW_DEMO)
